Optional exercise: Dynamic creation of parts based on a part descriptor [[tutorial_modeldynamics1"> === Create a class for the part descriptor
Create the following new class.
[[tutorial_modeldynamics_descriptor"> === Create the part descriptor model element
Create a part descriptor model element in your application model using the com.example.e4.rcp.todo.partdescriptor.dynamic ID. In the _Class URI_ field point to your new DynamicPart class.
image::partdescriptor10.png" scale="35" />
Defining a Part Descriptor,pdfwidth=60%]
The Multiple attribute should be flagged.
[[tutorial_modeldynamics2"> === Create a handler for creating new parts
Add a new handler and a new command for creating a new part to your application model. The code for the handler class should be similar to the following code.
Add a new menu called _Dynamic Contributions_ to your application model.
Also add a new menu entry to your new menu, pointing to your new command.
Start your application and validate that you can dynamically create and display new parts. As you have set the Multiple flag on the part descriptor, you can also open multiple instances of the part.
